questions.text: If 'X' is whole number (not equal to 0), then which of the following options must be the factor of 'X'.
questions.solution:
**1 is factor of all natural numbers.**
Hence, option A is correct.

questions.text:
If 'AB' is a two-digit natural number, then which of the following is true:
(i) One of the factors of AB is AB.
(ii) One of the factors of AB is 1.
(iii) There is more than two factors of AB.
questions.solution:
The number itself is always a factor of itself, then statement I is true.
**1 is factor of all-natural number**, so statement II is true.
It is not necessary, that the number of factors of AB is more than 2, so it is false
hence, option A is correct.

questions.text: Which of the following option is incorrect about the factors of 'K'. (K is a natural number)
options: One of the factors of K is 'A'. (A>K)
Number of factors of K is infinite.
If $$k=1$$, then K has only one factor.
More than one option is incorrect
Option A, B and C are correct
questions.solution:
**Option A:** Factors itself cannot be more than the number, so option A is incorrect.
**Option B:** Number of factors of any number cannot be infinite, so this is incorrect.
**Option C:** $$k=1$$, then it has only 1 factor, so this is correct.
Hence, **option D is correct** (as A and B are incorrect).

questions.text: If 'M' is a whole number and it has less than 2 factors, then which of the following can be the value of M.
questions.solution:
M can be 1 and 0 also which have less than 2 factors.
hence, **option D is correct**.

questions.text:
If A is a double-digit perfect number, then which of the following is/are correct:
(I) Sum of all the factors of A is equal to 2A.
(II) Difference of the largest and smallest factor of A is 27.
(III) Sum of the largest and smallest factor of A is 29.
questions.solution:
**I:** Sum of the factors of a perfect number is twice of the number itself, so statement I is correct.
**II:** $$A=28$$ (Smallest and largest factor = 1 and 28). Difference = $$28-1=27$$. So, it is correct.
**III:** $$A=28$$ (Smallest and largest factor = 1 and 28). Sum = $$28+1=29$$. So, it is correct.
Hence, **option D is correct**.

questions.text: If the factors of 'K' is a, b, c, d, and e and the value of $$(a+b+c+d)$$ is equal to e, then which of the following is true about 'K'. ($$e > a, b, c, d$$)
questions.solution:
In this case K is **perfect number**.
hence, option A is correct.

questions.text: Which of the following number have more than two prime factors:
questions.solution:
6 have factors = 1, 2, 3, 6
It has two prime factors = 2 and 3
hence, **option C is correct**.

questions.text: If the two factors out of all factors of 'K' are prime factors, such that the prime factors are consecutive natural number also, then find the possible value of 'K'
questions.solution:
Consecutive natural numbers which are prime also are 2 and 3 only.
Hence, option A, C and D can be the value of K (as they are multiples of 6).
**Answer: E**

questions.text:
Which of the following is/are true:
(I) The factors of 'A' cannot be more than 2. (A is a prime number)
(II) Sum of the least two perfect numbers are 34.
(III) The number of prime factors in 80 is 2.
questions.solution:
**I:** If A is prime number, it has two factors, so it is correct.
**II:** Least two perfect numbers = 6 and 28. Sum = $$6+28=34$$, so it is correct.
**III:** Factors of 80 = 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 10, 16, 20, 40, 80. Two prime factors = 2 and 5, so it is correct.
hence, **option D is correct**.

questions.text: If the number of factors of 'M' is 4 (a, b, c and d such that $$a>b>c>d$$) and out of these 4 factors 2 are prime factors ($$b \times c=d$$). Which of the following is correct for 'M'.
options: M is greater than 78 but less than 85.
M is greater than 83 and less than 86.
Both option A and B are correct
M is less than 80 and more than 77.
questions.solution:
If the number of factors of 'M' is 4 and 2 are prime factors ($$b \times c=d$$).
In this case 82 have factors = 1, 2, 41, 82
85 have = 1, 5, 17, 85
So, option A and B are correct, and **option C is right**.

questions.text: A four-digit number is formed by repeating a two-digit number like 4848. Then the resultant number will be divisible by is equal to X, then find the value of (X+40).
questions.solution:
If we add $$4800+48$$, When we take 48 common: $$48(100+1)$$.
This is 101.
If we repeat any two-digit number and form 4-digit number, so that will be divisible by only 101.
Answer is $$101+40=141$$.
Hence the correct option is **D**.

questions.text: If the 5-digit number 538ab is divisible by 3,7,11 then the value of sum of square of a and b both is how much % more or less than 457.
questions.solution:
The 5-digit number 538ab is divisible by 3,7,11.
$$7 \times 11 = 77$$, check its divisibility.
Make it 0538ab/77.
$$77 \times 10 = 770$$; $$77 \times 11 = 847$$.
If we add $$770+53=823$$ it is correct.
a, b = 2, 3.
Square of them = $$4+9=13$$.
Required %: $$\frac{444}{457} \times 100 = 97.15\%$$ (approx).
Hence the correct option is **B**.

questions.text: A number is divisible by 11 if the difference between the sum of its digits at odd places and the sum of its digits at even places is divisible by 11. Which of the following numbers is divisible by 11?
questions.solution:
Calculate the sum of digits at odd places and even places for each option.
Going through options:
A) 52713: $$15-3=12$$ (not satisfied)
B) 72466: $$17-6=11$$ (divisible by 11)
Hence the correct option is **B**.

questions.text: Find the largest 4-digit number divisible by both 8 and 12.
questions.solution:
A number divisible by 8 and 12 must also be divisible by their LCM.
LCM of them = 24.
The largest 4-digit number is 9999.
$$9999/24=416$$ and remainder 15.
$$24 \times 416 = 9984$$ (largest 4-digit number divisible by both 8 and 12).
Hence the correct option is **A**.

questions.text: If the 8-digit number 147856AB is divisible by 8 then find the total possible pairs of (AB).
questions.solution:
Divisibility rule of 8: if last 2 digits are multiple of 8 and the number just before it is even number.
Focus on last 3 numbers: 6AB/8.
AB pairs: 00, 08, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 72, 80, 88, 96.
Total **13 pairs**.
Hence the correct option is **B**.

questions.text: What is the sum of all the positive values of Y for which a seven - digit number 23Y567Y is divisible by 3.
questions.solution:
Divisibility of 3 = If sum of digits is divisible by 3.
Sum of digits of 23Y567Y: $$5+7+3+6=21$$.
Remaining = $$2+2y$$; it must be divisible by 3.
Y single digit possible values = 2, 5, 8.
Sum of them = 15.
Hence the correct option is **B**.

questions.text: Find the difference between squares of greatest value and the smallest value of T if the number 98901T is divisible by 9.
questions.solution:
Divisibility rule of 9 = If sum of its digits is multiple of 9.
$$9+8+9+0+1+T = 27+T$$.
T minimum possible value can be 0 ($$27+0=27$$).
T maximum possible value can be 9 ($$27+9=36$$).
Required difference between T's minimum and maximum values squares:
$$81 - 0 = 81$$.
Hence the correct option is **A**.

questions.text: If a nine-digit number $$378x4238y$$ is divisible by 72, then find the value of $$(x+23)$$ and $$(Y+45)$$ individually.
questions.solution:
Check the divisibility rule of 72 = $$9 \times 8$$.
**For 8:** Check last 3 digits (38y). $$384/8$$ is divisible, so $$Y=4$$.
**For 9:** Sum of its digits must be multiple of 9.
$$378x42384 \rightarrow 48+x$$.
$$x=6$$.
$$x+23 = 6+23 = 29$$.
$$Y+45 = 4+45 = 49$$.
Hence the correct option is **C**.

questions.text: If the number 78N2630N, is divisible by 6, then find the sum of all possible value of N.
questions.solution:
Divisibility rule of 6 = divisible by both 2 and 3.
Sum of digits (without N) = 26.
Total sum = $$26 + 2N$$.
If $$N=2$$, sum = 30 (divisible by 3).
If $$N=8$$, sum = 42 (divisible by 3).
Note: N must be even for divisibility by 2. N=5 is not possible.
Sum of possible values of N = $$2+8=10$$.
Hence the correct option is **A**.

questions.text: How many digits between 1 and 999 are divisible by 17.
questions.solution:
Largest 3-digit number = 999.
$$999/17 = 58$$ and remainder is 13.
Means 58 numbers in between 1 and 999 are divisible by 17.
Hence the correct option is **B**.
